observationText: The Nf1b+10 zebrafish line was generated using zinc finger nucleases targeting exon 17 of the nf1b gene, resulting in a null allele.
Zebrafish homozygous for the Nf1b+10 null allele in combination with a null allele of nf1a exhibit early larval lethality between 7-10 days post fertilization.
Nf1b+10 zebrafish homozygous for the null allele in combination with an nf1a null allele show hyperplasia of oligodendrocyte progenitor cells and Schwann cells starting at 4 days post fertilization.

Nf1b+10; nf1a null zebrafish larvae exhibit melanophore hypoplasia and disrupted pigmentation patterns along the lateral stripes, providing an animal model for the pigmentation defects seen in human NF1 patients.
Nf1b+10; nf1a null zebrafish larvae exhibit defects in learning and motor behaviors.
In a p53 mutant background, Nf1b+10; nf1a+/- zebrafish develop high-grade gliomas and malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors, demonstrating the tumor suppressor function of the nf1 genes.
Nf1b+10; nf1a null zebrafish larvae exhibit irregularities in the patterning of radial glial cells.
